Our Reference: 1115FXPLUS

Commercial Electrical Works

Requirements Overview Rationale

Falmouth FXPlus is seeking one or more suppliers for it's Commercial Electrical Works requirements for it's Penryn Campus in Cornwall - TR10 9FE and associated satellite Campuses. 

Our Commercial Electrical Works cover a wide scope of requirements.

 Commercial Electrical Works will involve larger and more complex projects which may require interdisciplinary team work and more advanced skill sets than that of the Domestic Electrical Services supplier e.g. ability to work with three-phase design. 
The main bulk of Commercial Electrical works is expected to be larger project related works as opposed to more service related requirements on the Domestic Electrical Agreement.

The Commercial Electrical Provider should be able to deliver the undertaking, of periodic servicing, testing, inspection, certification, maintenance, renewal and repair to Electrical related Works,  for which FXPlus holds repairing responsibility.

It is essential that we take on a high quality Supplier who can keep the Campuses functioning safely and efficiently over the duration of the agreement.

Description:
Dudley MBC requires suitable tenders for Electrical Inspection, Maintenance and Installation Contract. The work on this contract shall typically comprise of three main elements of Electrical work: Servicing / Inspection, Installations / Upgrades and Repairs.
      
      This contract shall comprise of carrying out:
      • Domestic Electrical Installation Condition Reports
      • Communal Electrical Installation Condition Reports
      • Domestic Electrical Rewires / Upgrades / Repairs
      • Communal Electrical Rewires / Upgrades / Repairs
      • Portable Appliance Testing
      
      The Sections are broken down thus:
      • Section A Preliminaries 
      • Section B Specification
      • Section C Carrying out Electrical Installation Condition Reports
      • Section D Carrying out Domestic Electrical Repairs & Installations
      • Section E Carrying out Communal Electrical Repairs & Installations
      • Section F Installing Electrical Cabling Containment & Cables
      • Section G Carrying out PAT Testing
      
      The Contractor shall price all of Sections C-G. 
      
      The contract and subsequent award(s) will be broken into two priced parts (LOTS) as detailed below. 
      
      LOT 1: Sections C,E,F,G
      • Section C Carrying out Electrical Installation Condition Reports
      • Section E Carrying out Communal Electrical Repairs & Installations

      • Section G Carrying out PAT Testing

      Please note: One contractor cannot be awarded both LOTS. Mandatory Requirements for this Contract are as follows:
      
      Minimum turnover of £1.9M
      SSIP (Safety Schemes in Procurement) Accreditation 
      NICEIC (National Inspection Council for Electrical Installation Contracting) and/or

      The Contractor must also remain a member for the above for the duration of the Contract.

Title: Internal & External Works 2016
Description:
Initial expressions of interest are invited from potential providers wishing to provide planned, cyclical and ad hoc external works services to occupied & vacant domestic housing & commercial properties throughout the area covered by Westworks, its members and partners. Providers appointed to the framework may be required to act as main contractor within projects and to utilise supply chains already or yet to be established by Westworks. Similarly providers may be required to act as a supply partner to users partnerships. These occurrences will be clearly indicated to potential providers at the time of contract call off by users and will be incorporated as part of the mini competition process.

The geographical area to be covered by this framework covers the South and South west of England. For an approximate distribution of the volume of works required please review the information in the suite of download documents.
We are therefore inviting variant bids based on GEOGRAPHICAL capability so as to encourage small to medium and larger enterprises to participate. Companies should make clear the areas within which they can presently deliver the services required. Limited geographical coverage by a potential provider will not necessarily exclude them from the process as it is Westworks members aim to encourage local employment and businesses as well as engaging with other suitably qualified providers. It is the intention of Westworks to engage with enough suitably qualified providers to achieve these aims. 

The TOTAL estimated value is between £1 million to £850 million over the entire 4 year life of the framework.

1. Kitchen Instalations

Title: Re:allies Gas Servicing and Maintenance Framework Agreement
Description:
Re:allies Works Ltd (Re:allies) is a social housing regeneration consortia. Its membership consists of regional housing consortia who bring together unmatched experience in procurement and regeneration. The membership currently consists of Procure Plus (PP), Efficiency North (EN) and Central Housing Investment Consortium (CHIC). Further information can be found by visiting www.re-allies.com

Re:allies has procured and entered into a framework agreement with multiple contractors for the gas servicing, maintenance and repair of existing installations. The service required within the framework will be a standard 3* comprehensive service and maintenance provision to gas fired central heating installations and miscellaneous gas appliances. The framework may, if required by the customer, also include the requirement to replace installations. Contractors will, where requested, be required to source non-consumable materials from framework agreements and contracts that have already been established by Re:allies. Contractors who have been appointed to the framework agreement will also be required to meet minimum training and employment targets that are linked to the services awarded via the framework agreement.

The framework agreement will allow contracting authorities named and referred to within the contract notice to enter into underlying contracts for the completion of the works and services covered by the framework agreement. The framework agreement is divided into 8 Lots and the details are as follows –
1.North West excluding Cumbria
2.Cumbria
3.West Yorkshire
4.South Yorkshire
5.East Yorkshire
6.Central England
7.South England
8.Wales

The framework agreement will be in place for a period of 48 months and will not be extended beyond this term. Contracts that are called off under the framework agreement may (where required) continue beyond the 48 month term of the framework agreement. Individual contracting authorities entitled to access the framework agreement will have the option to agree and award underlying contracts to the appointed contractors at any stage during the term of the framework agreement. Description:
We are seeking an Economic Operator to provide a planned preventative maintenance programme and reactive repairs of heating, ventilation and air conditioning for the West Midlands Fire and Rescue Authority at various sites in the West Midlands region. 
The Contract will be divided into the following work packages "Lots":
Lot 1 - Black Country Area
Lot 2 - Birmingham Area
Lot 3 - Coventry & Solihull Area
Economic Operators are invited to bid for all or any of the available lots- It is the preference of the Authority that all the above Lots will be awarded to a single Economic Operators. However, should it be more economically advantageous to do so, the Authority may award separate contracts for each Lot or a combination of Lots to separate Economic Operators. The contract shall be for a period of up to 4 years.
The successful Economic Operator will be required to carry out the planned maintenance/inspection visits to satisfy the Authority as to the general condition of the HVCA systems to ensure their efficient, safe, economical running and to indicate any repairs which may need to be carried out now or in the future.
The programme will include maintenance visits as detailed in the specification together with the provision of a 365, 24/7, emergency callout service with a maximum two hour call out time to cover plant or service breakdown.  
The Economic Operator must be experienced in this field and able to demonstrate its professional & technical competence in providing a regular service. Have suitably qualified/trained/certificated staff or Sub contractors for this field. (Refer to Schedule 1 for full list), The Economic Operator will be expected to be familiar with the Siemens Desigo PMX10 and Trend Control or arrange for relevant technicians to be trained in the systems by contract start which is anticipated to be the end of June 18.
